title: Hot Hotels: Vana, India
author: Condé Nast; Michelle Jana Chan
description: Michelle Jana Chan, editor of Vanity Fair On Travel, prioritizes philosophy over pampering.
cleaned_text: Tucked away in the foothills of the Himalayas, [Vana](http://www.vana.co.in/) is no regular hotel, nor destination spa, nor [wellness](https://www.vanityfair.com/alist/2018/02/wellness-treatments-london) clinic. Instead, lying amidst some of India's important Hindu pilgrimage sites, the home of the exiled Dalai Lama and the sacred Ganges River, it is a [spiritual retreat](https://www.vanityfair.com/alist/2018/02/reach-for-the-spas), more about the mind than any other matter, prioritizing philosophy over pampering. Through a gate, beyond the hum of idling traffic and the blast of car horns, twisting and turning along a driveway amidst clever landscaping of forest, bamboo and creepers, it feels like a secret sphere; after only a half-dozen years Vana already has legendary status in the world of [wellness](https://www.vanityfair.com/alist/2018/02/the-quest-for-wellness). The architecture is astounding. The main hall, with its uplifting vaulted ceilings, feels more like an award-winning concert venue than a lobby, and is decorated with a collection of gigantic mobiles: a flock of ceramic birds casts shadows on blank walls; oversized pebbles are suspended on invisible string; abstract lamps are made from silkworm cocoons. The vast spaces filled with conceptual art feel transformative. Add to that an assembly of expert therapists: Ayurvedic or rooted in traditional Chinese medicine or Tibetan Buddhism, and you will realize Vana is doing something very special here, and very rare. This summer [Healing Holidays](https://www.healingholidays.co.uk/) are offering a five-night quick-fix taster tonic at Vana, or seven or 14 nights for something stronger. Rates are outstanding value from May to October when many want to avoid the rainy season but it's rarely more than a shower. A seven-night stay with a Personalised Wellness Programme in a Forest or Garden suite starts from £2,350 per person sharing. This includes economy flights, airport transfers, full-board wellness cuisine and treatments, and consultations and private sessions. A 14-night stay starts from £3995 per person sharing.
